subject: Re: ClassNotFoundException
msgSnippet: I have already done the first, with no result. Checking my project directory under project_resources I find it is empty?! ... for all ... projects into ...
messageBody:
I have already done the first, with no result.
Checking my project directory under project_resources I find it is
empty?!


--- In junit@y..., "Jason Rogers" <jason.rogers@t...> wrote:
> If you are running in VAJ, just add the project_resources folder
for all
> projects into your workspace classpath or dynamically load all
projects into
> the workspace classpath. Here is a class that will run JUnit like
this,
> edit your JUnit tool's default.ini to point to this class.
>
>
> package <your package>;
>
> import junit.<your favorite ui>.*;
>
> public class JUnitLauncher {
> public JUnitLauncher() {}
> public static void main(String args[]) {
> JUnitLauncher.setClassPath();
> TestRunner.main(args);
> }
> /**
> * Update the classpath to include all workspace projects.
> */
> public void setClassPath() throws IvjException {
>
> Workspace workspace = ToolEnv.connectToWorkspace();
> Object[] classpath = workspace.getClassPathEntries();
> Object[] projects = workspace.getProjects();
> Object[] newClasspath = new Object[classpath.length +
> projects.length];
>
> //add the projects to the new classpath
> System.arraycopy(projects, 0, newClasspath, 0,
projects.length);
>
> //add the original classpath to the new classpath
> System.arraycopy(classpath, 0, newClasspath, projects.length,
> classpath.length);
>
> try {
> workspace.setClassPath(newClasspath);
> } catch(IvjException e) {
> e.printStackTrace();
> }
>
> }
> }
>
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: messy_head_2001@y... [mailto:messy_head_2001@y...]
> > Sent: Wednesday, August 22, 2001 11:44 AM
> > To: junit@y...
> > Subject: [junit] Re: ClassNotFoundException
> >
> >
> > is there any way to force it to load the missing classes?
> >
> > --- In junit@y..., "Jason Rogers" <jason.rogers@t...> wrote:
> > > That class was probably not loaded in by your class loader.
> > >
> > > > -----Original Message-----
> > > > From: messy_head_2001@y...
[mailto:messy_head_2001@y...]
> > > > Sent: Wednesday, August 22, 2001 9:47 AM
> > > > To: junit@y...
> > > > Subject: [junit] ClassNotFoundException
> > > >
> > > >
> > > > I am trying to use JUnit to test a method which calls
> > > >
> > > > Class.forName("myClassName")
> > > >
> > > > however I get a ClassNotFoundException from this line
of
> > > > code, which
> > > > works perfectly when not using JUnit.
> > > >
> > > > Any ideas??
> > > >
> > > > David.
> > > >
